name: Sufi Senegal
creator: Eric S. Ross, Associate Professor, Al Akhawayn University

properties.Name: Mausolée de Cheikh Anta Mbacké
properties.Description: Mausoleum of Cheikh Anta Mbacké (1861-1940)

properties.Name: Keur Gumak
properties.Description: House where Seydina Issa Rohou Laye lived from 1914 until his death in 1949.

properties.Name: Keur Goumak
properties.Description: House where Seydina Mouhammadou Limamou Laye lived from 1886 until his death in 1909.

properties.Name: Protection civile
properties.Description: fire department

properties.Name: Mosquée de Serign Souhaïbou
properties.Description: Serign Souhaïbou Mbacké (1921-1991) is buried here.

properties.Name: Mausolée de Mame Diarra Bousso
properties.Description: Burial place of Mame Diarra Bousso (d. 1866), mother of Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba.

properties.Name: Grande mosquée de Diourbel
properties.Description: This mosque was built by Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba in 1916. See a plan of this Sufi neighborhood at http://www.aui.ma/personal/~E.Ross/diourbel.htm

properties.Name: Mausolée de Mame Tierno Brahim
properties.Description: Mausoleum of Mame Tierno Birahim Mbacké (1866-1943).

properties.Name: Baïti
properties.Description: Home of Mame Tierno Birahim Mbacké from 1912 until his death in 1943.

properties.Name: Baïty
properties.Description: Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba lived in this house prior to his exile in 1895. His son, Serign Mouhamadou Moustapha Mbacké (first Caliph of the Mourides) also lived here from 1912 until his death in 1945. Some of Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba's personal belongings are kept here.

properties.Name: Mausolée de Cheikh Ibra Fall
properties.Description: This large mausoleum contains the tombs of Cheikh Ibra Fall (d. 1930), founder of the Baye Fall movement, as well as those of his sons.

properties.Name: Keur Serigne Touba
properties.Description: Also called the "Résidence", this is the official audience hall of the Caliph-General. It was built in 1978.

properties.Name: Bibliothèque de Touba
properties.Description: Also called the Maktabat Cheikhoul Khadim, built in 1977.

properties.Name: Mausolée de Serign Abdoul Ahad
properties.Description: Serign Abdoul Ahad Mbacké (1913-1989), third Calip-General of the Mourides, is buried here.

properties.Name: Mausolée de Serign Mourtada
properties.Description: Serign Mourtada Mbacké (1925-2004) is buried here.

properties.Name: Mausolée de Serigne Abdou Khadre
properties.Description: El-Hadj Serigne Abdou Khadre Mbacké (1914-1990), fourth Caliph-General of the Mourides, is buried here.

properties.Name: Mausolée de Serign Falilou
properties.Description: El Hadj Serigne Falilou Mbacké (1887-1968), second Caliph-General of the Mourides, is buried here.

properties.Name: Mausolée de Serign Mouhamadou Moustapha
properties.Description: Serigne Mouhamadou Moustapha Mbacké (1886-1945), first Caliph of the Mourides, is buried here.

properties.Name: Nguidjilone
properties.Description: One of the oldest centers of Islamic learning in the Fouta Toro. Date established: not known.

properties.Name: Thilogne
properties.Description: A reknowned center of Islamic instruction in the pre-colonial period. Date established: not known.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Guédé
properties.Description: Guédé was one of the oldest towns in the Fouta Toro. It was an important political center for the Denyanke dynasty (1490-1776). Guédé's mosque is reputed to be one of the oldest in Senegal. It was first built c. 1670 and then rebuilt in 1776, in the 1850s and again in 1942. It is listed as a national historic monument. Guédé is also the original home of the Bousso lineage, important to the Mouride order.

properties.Name: Pénc de Ndiaré
properties.Description: Autonomous Muslim settlement of the pre-colonial era. According to Cheikh Anta Diop, Ndiaré was established by the Ndiaye lineage. Date established: possibly 17th cent.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Niomré
properties.Description: Established by Serigne Matar Naar Lo in the 18th cent. An important political center for the Ndiambour clerics.

properties.Name: Koki
properties.Description: Established by Mukhtar Ndoumbe Diop early in the 18th cent. Koki was one of the most important centers of Islamic learning in Kayor and is currently still home to an Institute of Islamic Studies.

properties.Name: Institut Islamique
properties.Description: Louga was an important political center for Ndiambour clerics in the pre-colonial period. Date established: not known, probably mid-18th cent.

properties.Name: Grande mosquée de Pire
properties.Description: Established by Khali Amar Fall either in 1600 or in 1690. Pire was one of the most important centers of Islamic instruction in pre-colonial Kayor. The town is still home to an institute of Islamic instruction today. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serigne Ahmadou Cisse Pire, affiliated to the Tijaniyya of Tivaouane.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Diawara Alkali
properties.Description: The Muslim town of Diawara Alkali dates from the pre-colonial era. Date established.: not known.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Tawa
properties.Description: Tawa was established c. 1810 by Ndiougou Ba, the father of Maba Diakhou.

properties.Name: Goundiuorou, Bundu
properties.Description: Pre-colonial center of Islamic learning. Established by Jakhanke clerics c. 1700.

properties.Name: Didécoto
properties.Description: Pre-colonial center of Islamic learning. Established by Jakhanke clerics c. 1750.

properties.Name: Bani Israila
properties.Description: Pre-colonial center of Islamic learning. Established by Jakhanke clerics c. 1750.

properties.Name: Diakha Madina
properties.Description: Pre-colonial center of Islamic learning. Established by Jakhanke clerics, date unknown.

properties.Name: Touba, Fouta Jallon
properties.Description: Most important center of Jakhanke scholarship throughout 19th cent. Touba was established in Fouta Jallon by Al-Hajj Salim Gassama (aka, Karamokho Ba) in 1822. It maintains a strong affiliation to the Qadiriyyah order.

properties.Name: Gunjur Mosque
properties.Description: Gunjur is the principal Jakhanke center of Lower Gambia. Gunjur was established late in the 19th century.

properties.Name: Boutilimit
properties.Description: Home to the Sidiyya-Qadiriyya order. Boutilimit was established by Cheikh Sidiyya al-Kabir in the late 1820s. Current caliph: ?

properties.Name: Nimjat
properties.Description: Home to the Fadhiliyya-Qadiriyya order. Nimjat was established by Cheikh Saad Buh b. Muhammad al-Fadhil c. 1910. Current caliph: Sheikh Saad Buh al-Fadhil.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Ndiassane
properties.Description: Home to the Kounta-Qadiriyya order. Ndiassane was established by Cheikh Bou Kounta in 1884. Current Caliph: Al-Hajj Mame Bou Mamadou Kounta. See plan of this Sufi town at http://www.aui.ma/personal/~E.Ross/ndiassane.htm

properties.Name: Mosquée des Khadres
properties.Description: This Qâdirî zâwiyah was established by the Kounta-Qadiriyyah of Ndiassane c. 1880s.

properties.Name: Maka
properties.Description: Make was established by the Jakhanke cheikh Al-Hajj Soriba Ibrahim Jabi in 1956. It is affiliated to the Qadiriyyah order of Touba in Fouta Jallon (Guinea).

properties.Name: Mosquée de Yoff-Layenne
properties.Description: Principal shrine of the Layenne order. Yoff-Layenne was established by Seydina Mouhammadou Limamou Laye c. 1886. The original mosque was rebuilt in 1925, enlarged in 1949, and refurbished again in 1987. Current caliph: Al-Hajj Abdoulaye Thiaw-Laye. See plan of this Sufi shrine at http://www.aui.ma/personal/~E.Ross/yoff.htm

properties.Name: Mausolée de Seydina Mouhammadou Limamou Laye
properties.Description: Mausoleum of Seydina Mouhammadou Limamou Laye (1844-1909).

properties.Name: Mosquée de Cambérène
properties.Description: Important Layenne shrine. Cambérène was established by Seydina Issa Rohou Laye in 1914. The mosque was built in 1937 and enlarged in 1988. Current caliph: Al-Hajj Abdoulaye Thiaw-Laye. See plan of this Sufi shrine at http://www.aui.ma/personal/~E.Ross/camberene.htm

properties.Name: Mausolée de Seydina Issa Rohou Laye
properties.Description: Mausoleum of Seydina Issa Rohou Laye (1876-1949).

properties.Name: Dinguiraye
properties.Description: Established by the Tijani cheikh Al-Hajj Omar Tall in 1851.

properties.Name: Bogué
properties.Description: Important Tijani center on the Mauritanian side of the border.

properties.Name: Zâwiyah El-Hadj Malick Sy
properties.Description: Tivaouane is one of the most important centers of the Tijaniyya in Senegal. El Hajj Malick Sy (1855-1922) established himself in this neighborhood in 1902. This zawiyah was built in 1907. Current caliph: Serigne Mansour Ababacar Sy. See a plan of this Sufi neighborhood at http://www.aui.ma/personal/~E.Ross/tivaouane.htm

properties.Name: Mosquée El-Hadj Ababacar Sy
properties.Description: This Mosque-mausoleum complex was built in 1957 to house the tomb of Khalifa Ababacar Sy (1884-1957). See plan of this Sufi neighborhood at http://www.aui.ma/personal/~E.Ross/tivaouane.htm

properties.Name: Grande mosquée de Tivaouane
properties.Description: Main mosque of the Sy Tijaniyyah of Tivaouane. Still under construction. See plan of the Sufi neighborhood at http://www.aui.ma/personal/~E.Ross/tivaouane.htm

properties.Name: Tijânî zâwiyah
properties.Description: This zâwiyyah was established in early 1890s by Al-Hajj Malick Sy, founder of the Tivaouane branch of the Tijaniyya order.

properties.Name: Tijânî zâwiyah
properties.Description: This zâwiyah was established by the Tivaouane branch of the Tijaniyya order c. 1910.

properties.Name: Fass Touré
properties.Description: Established by Serigne Tit Toure in 1894. It has an Institute of Islamic studies affiliated to the Tijaniyya. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serigne Tit Toure.

properties.Name: Mosquée deTaïba Niassène
properties.Description: Established by the Tijânî cheikh Al-Hajj Abdoulaye Niass (1844-1922) in the early 1880s. Birthplace of El-Hajj Ibrahima Niass (1900-1975).

properties.Name: Zâwiyah de Leona
properties.Description: This Tijânî zâwiya was established in Kaolack's Leona neighborhood by Al-Hajj Abdoulaye Niass (1844-1922) in 1910. Current caliph: Al-Hajj Abdoulaye Khalifa Niass.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Madina Baye
properties.Description: This Tijânî neighborhood was established by Al-Hajj Ibrahima Niass (1900-1975) in the 1930s. It is home to the Jamaat al-Fayda, or Tarbiyya, branch of the Tijaniyya. Current caliph: Al-Hajj Ahmed Ibrahima Niass. See a plan of this Sufi neighborhood at http://www.aui.ma/personal/~E.Ross/kaolack.htm

properties.Name: Médina el-Hadji
properties.Description: Established by the Tijani cheikh Al-Hajj Tierno Aliou Thiam in 1918.

properties.Name: Madina Gounass
properties.Description: Established by Al-Hajj Tierno Seydou Ba (1898-1980) in 1935. It is home to one branch of the Tijaniyya order. The Sufi city of Madina Gounass has autonomous status within Senegal. Current caliph: Al-Hajj Tierno Ahmed Tidian Ba.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Tiénaba
properties.Description: Established by Amary Ndack Seck (1830-1899) in 1882. Tiénaba is home to the Mahdiyya branch of the Tijaniyya order. Current caliph: Serigne Ousseynou Khar Seck. See a plan of this Sufi town at http://www.aui.ma/personal/~E.Ross/tienaba.htm

properties.Name: Grande mosquée de Mbacké
properties.Description: Established by Mame Marame (d. 1802) c. 1796. Mbacké became an important center of Islamic learning in first half of 19th century. Mbacké remains an important Mouride city today.

properties.Name: Palène
properties.Description: Home to Mbacke's Baye Fall community.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Gawane
properties.Description: Mbacké's Gawane neighborhood was established by Al-Hajj Serigne Tako Mbacke (d. 1975), son of Cheikh Anta Mbacke, c. 1950. This mosque was built in the early 1990s. Jurisdiction: lineage of Sheikh Anta Mbacke.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Darou Salam
properties.Description: Darou Salam was established by Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba Mbacke in 1884. Jurisdiction: lineage of Cheikh Anta Mbacke. Current caliph: ?

properties.Name: Pénc de Ndame
properties.Description: Originally called Darou Alimoul Khabir, Ndame was established by Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba Mbacke c. 1890. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serigne Abderrahmane Lo.

properties.Name: AL Azhar Institute
properties.Description: Major institute of Islamic education. Established by Serigne Mourtada Mbacke c. 1970s. Currently undergoing major expansion.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Touba Al-Azhar
properties.Description: Al-Azhar was established by Cheikh Mbacke Bousso in 1903. Jurisdiction: lineage of Cheikh Mbacke Bousso. Current imam: Serign Tierno Bousso.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Darou Marnane
properties.Description: Darou Marnane was established by Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba Mbacke in 1892. Jurisdiction: lineages of Serigne Abdou Rahmane Mbacke and of Serigne Abdou Rahim Mbacke.

properties.Name: Keur Serign Touba
properties.Description: Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba lived here between his two exiles (1902-1903).

properties.Name: Grande mosquée de Touba
properties.Description: Touba is the principal shrine-city of the Mouride order. It was established by Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba Mbacke in 1887. This mosque was built between 1930 and 1963. It was enlarged in 1988 and embellished in 1996. The Sufi city of Touba has autonomous status within Senegal. Jurisdiction: direct descendants of Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba Mbacke. Current Caliph-General: Serign Saliou Mbacke. see plans and maps of this Sufi city at http://www.aui.ma/personal/~E.Ross/touba.htm

properties.Name: Mausolée de Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba
properties.Description: The Sufi sheikh Ahmadou Bamba Mbacké (1853-1927), founder of Touba, is buried under this dome

properties.Name: Mosquée de Darou Khoudoss
properties.Description: Darou Khoudoss was established by Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba Mbacke c. 1890. It was re-established by Serign Mouhammadou Moustapha Mbacke (Caliph-General of the Mourides 1927-1945) in 1912. The mosque marks the founder's mystical encounter with the Prophet Muhammad in 1894. It has been rebuilt several times, most recently in 2006-2008. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serign Mouhammadou Moustapha Mbacke. Mosque currently being rebuilt. Current caliph: Serigne Ahmadou Mokhtar Mbacke.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Darou Minam
properties.Description: Darou Minam was established by Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba Mbacke c. 1890 and re-established by Serign Bassirou Mbacke (1895-1966) c. 1930. This mosque-mausoleum complex was built following Serign Bassirou's death in 1966. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serign Bassirou Mbacke. Current caliph: Serigne Moustapha Bassirou Mbacke.

properties.Name: Pénc de Gouye Mbind
properties.Description: Gouye Mbind ward was established by Serigne Abdoul Aziz Mbacke (d. 1989), son of Serigne Lamine Bara Mbacke (1888-1936), c. 1945. Jursidiction: lineage of Serigne Lamine Bara. Current caliph: Serigne Cheikh Mati Leye Mbacke.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Guédé Bousso
properties.Description: Guédé Bousso was established by Cheikh Mbacke Bousso (1864-1945) in 1918. He is buried in a mausoleum integrated into the mosque. Jursdiction: lineage of Cheikh Mbacke Bousso. Current imam: Serigne Modou Mahmoune Bousso.

properties.Name: Hizbut-Tarqiyyah Center
properties.Description: Headquarters of the Hizbut-Tarqiyyah Association (Touba Massar neighborhood). This major Mouride cultural and educational association moved here from Dakar in 1995.

properties.Name: Pénc de Palène
properties.Description: Home to Touba's Baye Fall community.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Khaïra
properties.Description: Touba Khaïra was established by Serign Modou Bousso Dieng Mbacke (d. 2002), son of Serign Falilou (Caliph-General of the Mourides 1945-1968), in 1968. Jurisdiction of Serign Falilou Mbacke's lineage. Current caliph: Al-Hajj Serigne Bara Mbacke.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Keur Niang
properties.Description: Keur Niang was established by Serigne Ahmadou Fadiama Niang in 1892. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serigne Ahmadou Fadiama Niang.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Djannatoul Mahwa
properties.Description: Djannatoul Mahwa ward was established by Serign Saliou Mbacke (Caliph-General of the Mourides since 1990) in 1981. This mosque was built in 1997 and is currently (2007) being entirely rebuilt.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Darou Tanzil
properties.Description: Darou Tanzil neighborhood was established by Serign Moustapha Abdoul Aziz Mbacke (d. 1998) in 1993. Construction of the mosque began in 2000. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serigne Abdoul Aziz Moustapha Mbacke. Current imam: Serigne Aziz Moustapha Mbacke.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Same Lâ
properties.Description: Same (named for Shâm, i.e., Syria) was established next to the existing village of Lâ by Mame More Diarra Mbacke (1841-1921) in 1882. Jurisdiction: lineage of Mame More Diarra Mbacke.

properties.Name: Pénc de Darou Rahmane II
properties.Description: Darou Rahmane II was established by Serign Ahmadou Ba Sylla in 1934.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Darou Karim
properties.Description: Darou Karim was established by Serign Massamba Mbacke (1881-1942) in 1912. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serign Massamba Mbacke. Current caliph: Serigne Modou Mai Mbacke.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Darou Khadim
properties.Description: Darou Khadim was established by Serigne Massamba Kani Bousso (d. 1935) in 1914. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serigne Massamba Kani Bousso.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Touba Bagdad
properties.Description: Established by Serign Abdou Khadre Mbacke (Caliph-General of the Mourides 1989-1990) in 1969. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serigne Abdou Khadre Mbacke. Current caliph: Serign Cheikh Abdou Khadre Mbacke.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Tindodi
properties.Description: First called Housnoul Mahabine, Tindodi (or Tindoli) was established by Serign Mouhammadou Moustapha Mbacke (Caliph-General of the Mourides 1927-1945) in 1912.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Ndindi Abdou
properties.Description: Ndindi Andou was established by Serign Falilou Mbacke (Caliph-General of the Mourides 1945-1968) in 1914. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serigne Falilou Mbacke. Current imam: Serigne Abdou Fatah Mbacke.

properties.Name: Pénc de Darou Rahmane I
properties.Description: Darou Rahmane I was established by Serigne Abdoulahi Mbacke (d. 1960) in 1930.

properties.Name: Matlaboul Fawzaini Center
properties.Description: Headquarters of the Matlaboul Fawzaini Association. Established in 2004.

properties.Name: Pénc de Touba Fall
properties.Description: Touba Fall was established c. 1915 by Cheikh Aliou Fall, son of Cheikh Ibra Fall (founder of the Baye Fall movement).

properties.Name: Mosquée de Khourou Mbacké
properties.Description: Khourou Mbacké may possibly be the birthplace of Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba Mbacke. Jurisdiction: Diakhate lineage.

properties.Name: Grande mosquée de Darou Mousty
properties.Description: Darou Mousty is considered the "second city" of the Mouride order. It was established by Mame Tierno Birahim Mbacke (1866-1943) in 1912. Jurisdiction: lineage of Mame Tierno Birahim Mbacke. Current caliph: Serigne Cheikh Mbacke Khady. See a plan of this Sufi city at http://www.aui.ma/personal/~E.Ross/daroumousty.htm

properties.Name: Darou Marnane-Mbacol
properties.Description: This Darou Marnane, in Mbacol province, was established by Al-Hajj Serigne Awa Balla Mbacke (d. 1976). Jurisdiction: lineage of Serigne Awa Balla Mbacke.

properties.Name: Mbacké Kayor
properties.Description: Mbacké Kayor was established in 1880 by Momar Anta Sali Mbacke (1822-1882), father of Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serigne Lamine Bara Mbacke.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Touba Bélel
properties.Description: Touba Bélel was established by Serign Abdoul Ahad Mbacke (Caliph-General of the Mourides 1968-1989). He used the place as a country residence when he was not in Touba.

properties.Name: Mosquée de Taïf
properties.Description: Taïf was established by Serign Cheikh Mbacke (1905-1978) c. 1940. He used the place as a country residence and experimental farm.

properties.Name: Keur Goumak
properties.Description: Place where Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba Mbacke lived under house arrest from 1912 until his death in 1927. See a plan of this Sufi neighborhood at http://www.aui.ma/personal/~E.Ross/diourbel.htm

properties.Name: Mosquée de Porokhane
properties.Description: Porokhane was established by Momar Anta Sali Mbacke (1822-1882) in 1864. The Mbacké family lived here until 1872. Jurisdiction: lineage of Serigne Bassirou Mbacke. Home to a large school for girls. Current caliph: Serigne Moustapha Bassirou Mbacke.
